visualization_prompt: Generate a Highcharts map chart showing geographical Points of Interest (POIs) using OpenStreetMap basemap tiles and coordinate plotting
visualization_explanation: The visualization uses a two-layered geographic approach with (1) base mapping tiles providing spatial context and (2) point data representing discrete locations. The synthetic POI dataset contains geocoordinates with decimal degree precision (6.5811472°E, 61.08707°N) demonstrating precise location plotting. The OpenStreetMap basemap serves as a topologically accurate reference layer. Chart design follows Tufte's principles by maximizing data-ink ratio through uncluttered basemap styling and Cairo's perceptual effectiveness through clear marker symbology. Navigation controls use #2caffe/#000066 color pairing for optimal contrast (4.5:1 ratio), while 14px axis labels maintain WCAG AA compliance. The centered viewport (zoom 13) balances context and detail, equivalent to ~1:10,000 scale mapping.
